comments.body: Hi, youâ€™re a beautiful queen with a big ass brain and I love you
comments.name: Taylor

improvementComments.body: I realize this could be better. But instead of doing something about it, I'm just going to twll you about it. I feel like I should get a free pass
improvementComments.name: Improvements

improvementComments.body: I definitely should have just started with Dagger. But I though hey, only one VM who needs that? You do, Sierra. You're wrong like always. But you're also running out of time so maybe it'll get implemented. Maybe it won't
improvementComments.name: Dagger

improvementComments.body: These retrofit calls come back wrapped as a API response and I should really put a helper class somewhere to unwrap it so I don't have to deal with that garbage in my view model.
improvementComments.name: API Responses

improvementComments.body: Sometimes this fake server craps out on me and I'm handing the error, but it takes FOREVER. I should really add a loading screen so that the user knows it's trying. Just like me.
improvementComments.name: Loading

improvementComments.body: There should be some kind of field validate on that add comment form. The date should just be a time stamp when the button it pushed and then formatted to display correctly.
improvementComments.name: Field validation

improvementComments.body: I hate testing, she says to the guy who teaches teasting. I need to implement some idle responses in the espresso tests to make them work when it comes back from a network call instead of the data base. Also when I add something to the list in the test, it actually adds it to the list. That's weird and annoying.
improvementComments.name: Espresso

improvementComments.body: I'd like to have a random word generator in my dialogs. But that's just for funsies, to enhance the experience.
improvementComments.name: Dialogs

improvementComments.body: I should put these things in a datbase and be able to insert them in app as I think of more things. In fact, I could probably but these and the regular comments together, add a tag, store them in the same database and filter based on which kind of tag it is. I might do that.
improvementComments.name: This page

improvementComments.body: I should do a better job caching these responses
improvementComments.name: Cache
